page.title: 02Tourism - Constable Country
page.content: One of the reasons Dedham is famous and tourists come here is that John Constable went to school and painted there. Constable was born in 1776 in East Bergholt near Dedham.His father owned water and wind mills and wished John to follow in his footsteps.In 1795 he went to London to study,and four years later became a student at the Royal Academy.Until he was about 30 he learnt by imitating famous painters.Then he started painting landscapes of the beautiful Dedham Vale,which made him and Dedham famous. His paintings looked very realistic. "Dedham Vale","The Haywain"and the "The Cornfield"are among his most famous works. Sir Alfred Munnings lived in the village. Castle House, where he lived has many of his paintings and is open to the public twice a week.
